title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language "CHIP IN"

media$title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language "CHIP IN"

media$description.$t:
This is the 19th idiom of the week, in American Sign Language (ASL) taught by Avery Posner who is part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd. This is part of our free weekly video on how to express English idioms in ASL and also how to recognize and use ASL idioms. Don't miss it, join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Wonder where all our other idioms are? Find more recently added free idioms in ASL exclusively shown at www.EverydayASL.com Idiom of the Week feature - updated every week! Be sure to also visit one of our videos narrating about the importance of understanding idioms in ASL by learning how to express English idioms in ASL and ASL idioms as well.

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our upcoming Idioms in ASL DVD, coming this spring!

content.$t:
This is the 19th idiom of the week, in American Sign Language (ASL) taught by Avery Posner who is part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd. This is part of our free weekly video on how to express English idioms in ASL and also how to recognize and use ASL idioms. Don't miss it, join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Wonder where all our other idioms are? Find more recently added free idioms in ASL exclusively shown at www.EverydayASL.com Idiom of the Week feature - updated every week! Be sure to also visit one of our videos narrating about the importance of understanding idioms in ASL by learning how to express English idioms in ASL and ASL idioms as well.

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our upcoming Idioms in ASL DVD, coming this spring!

title.$t: ASL Music Video "They Want Your Love"

media$title.$t: ASL Music Video "They Want Your Love"

media$description.$t:
This is the 2nd ASL music video from Everyday ASL Productions (www.EverydayASL.com). An American Sign Language music video by Avery Posner, who is expressing songs in ASL and is a part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd.

Part of the music video is in tribute to the North Shore Animal League of America's no-kill animal shelter rescuing cats and dogs. Please visit www.nsal.org

Enjoy and be sure to absorb the visual aspect of the language, the feelings that is brought out from the singer using ASL.

Also learn Idioms in American Sign Language, the most sought after feature throughout our organization and the rest of the world - you can join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our Idioms in ASL DVD series today.

content.$t:
This is the 2nd ASL music video from Everyday ASL Productions (www.EverydayASL.com). An American Sign Language music video by Avery Posner, who is expressing songs in ASL and is a part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd.

Part of the music video is in tribute to the North Shore Animal League of America's no-kill animal shelter rescuing cats and dogs. Please visit www.nsal.org

Enjoy and be sure to absorb the visual aspect of the language, the feelings that is brought out from the singer using ASL.

Also learn Idioms in American Sign Language, the most sought after feature throughout our organization and the rest of the world - you can join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our Idioms in ASL DVD series today.

title.$t: ASL Music Video "Goodbye, My Friend"

media$title.$t: ASL Music Video "Goodbye, My Friend"

media$description.$t:
This is a first for Everyday ASL Productions (www.EverydayASL.com). An American Sign Language music video by Gilda Ganezer, who is an expert in expressing songs from her heart in ASL and is a VERY valuable part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd.

Part of the music video is in tribute to California Wildlife Center's brave staff who does nothing but to rescue animals, from coyotes to seals. Goliath, the 800 pound seal seen in the music video were rescued by a team of professionals along with the help of several firefighters. The filming of the seal was captured by a now California Wildlife Center's staff, Jonsie Ross. Please visit www.californiawildlifecenter.org

Enjoy and be sure to absorb the visual aspect of the language, the feelings that is brought out from the singer using ASL.

Also watch Gilda teach Idioms in American Sign Language, the most sought after feature throughout our organization and the rest of the world - you can join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our Idioms in ASL DVD series today.

title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language "LAID UP"

media$title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language "LAID UP"

media$description.$t:
This is the 17th idiom of the week, in American Sign Language (ASL) taught by Avery Posner who is part of a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers; a courtesy of Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd. This is part of our free weekly video on how to express English idioms in ASL and also how to recognize and use ASL idioms. Don't miss it, join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Wonder where all our other idioms are? Find more recently added free idioms in ASL exclusively shown at www.EverydayASL.com Idiom of the Week feature - updated every week! Be sure to also visit one of our videos narrating about the importance of understanding idioms in ASL by learning how to express English idioms in ASL and ASL idioms as well.

Enjoy and share with everyone! Be sure to sign up to learn about our upcoming Idioms in ASL DVD, coming this spring!

title.$t: ASL Storytelling Contest #1 STORY EXAMPLE PART TWO

media$title.$t: ASL Storytelling Contest #1 STORY EXAMPLE PART TWO

media$description.$t:
(For transcript to this video, please go to http://everydayasl.com/contest and download a transcript upon degree of need)

Summary: This video shows the conclusion to the example ASL story, "A Tale of Two Environments".

To learn about updates on our first American Sign Language Storytelling Contest, made possible by Everyday ASL Productions (www.everydayasl.com) in celebrating recent launch of a brand new 2-disc ASL DVD: "American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Volume 1".  Click to learn about new rules and new schedule!

There will be extended time to participate in the contest for fun and prizes.  You can learn more by going to our website at:

http://everydayasl.com/contest

and learn how to register and be part of a large ASL community.

Important Contest Dates:

November 16, 2007: Contest #1 begins

February 22, 2008: Contest #1 ends

February 23, 2008: 3 Finalists selected by
                   judges and notified

February 26, 2008: 3 Finalists' videos
                   posted & voted by 
                   Youtube.com members

March 11, 2008: Members voting ends

March 13, 2008: 1st, 2nd & 3rd place
                  winners announced
---------------------------------------------------------------
*** Be sure to LOOK FOR "ASL Storytelling Contest #1 UPDATE & STORY EXAMPLE PART ONE" at 

http://www.youtube.com/everydayasl

title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language Narration - Intro

media$title.$t: Idiom in American Sign Language Narration - Intro

media$description.$t:
This is the narration reviewing the Everyday ASL Productions' Idiom of the Week feature, which is presented in American Sign Language (ASL) and taught by a team of Deaf ASL educators and filmmakers.  This project is made possible by Everyday ASL Productions, Ltd.  This marks as a prelude to free weekly video on how to express English idioms in ASL and also how to recognize and use ASL idioms.  Don't miss it, join us via subscription at:

http://www.EverydayASL.com/idiom

Find more free idioms in ASL exclusively shown at EverydayASL.com's Idiom of the Week feature - updated every week!  

Enjoy and share with everyone!

title.$t: American Sign Language (ASL) Gifts, Apparel & T-Shirts #1

media$title.$t: American Sign Language (ASL) Gifts, Apparel & T-Shirts #1

media$description.$t:
Welcome to HeartfulExpressions.com - a store where you can look around and find messages and images true to your heart about the world around you and others - including American Sign Language (ASL), fields of ASL interpreting, Deaf Culture, ASL Linguistics and, of course, a little moment to laugh with ASL / Interpreting Humor.  Find something for someone special - your friend, family or just about anyone! You will be certain to find one that expresses true to one's heart.

Visit http://HeartfulExpressions.com

A portion of all net proceeds will be donated to several animal caring organizations. Click to learn more about our sister company specializing in American Sign Language education and animal kindness, Everyday ASL Productions at http://EverydayASL.com

Find something for someone special - your friend, family or just about anyone! You will be certain to find one that expresses true to one's heart.

Visit http://HeartfulExpressions.com

A portion of all net proceeds will be donated to several animal caring organizations. Click to learn more about our sister company specializing in American Sign Language education and animal kindness, Everyday ASL Productions at http://EverydayASL.com

title.$t: American Sign Language (ASL) Storytelling Contest #1

media$title.$t: American Sign Language (ASL) Storytelling Contest #1

media$description.$t:
This is the first American Sign Language Storytelling Contest made possible by Everyday ASL Productions (www.everydayasl.com) in celebrating recent launch of a brand new 2-disc ASL DVD: "American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Volume 1" at:

http://everydayasl.com/DVD1main110107.htm

This nearly 3-hour DVD package will help viewers learn the fundamentals of American Sign Language about everyday life with fun and lessons about kindness and compassion.

To participate in the contest for fun and prizes, please go to:

http://everydayasl.com/contest

and learn how to register and be part of a large ASL community.

Important Contest Dates:

November 16, 2007: Contest #1 begins

January 11, 2008: Contest #1 ends

January 12, 2008: 3 Finalists selected by
                   judges and notified

January 15, 2008: 3 Finalists' videos
                   posted & voted by 
                   Youtube.com members

January 29, 2008: Members voting ends

January 31, 2008: 1st, 2nd & 3rd place
                  winners announced

title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 1 Preview #3

media$title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 1 Preview #3

media$description.$t:
This DVD # 1's menu preview is a small part of the 3+ hour DVD - teaching idioms, classifiers and a diverse number of ASL structures as well as ASL storytelling.

There are over 35 chapters throughout the 2-disc special edition DVD package that will be available throughout the United States and the rest of the world, wherever possible. Play this preview often to see how diverse and education-rich the DVD package will be for every viewer.

This is the first ASL DVD for kids and adults to learn the fundamentals of American Sign Language about everyday life with fun and lessons about kindness and compassion.

Go to www.everydayasl.com to sign up to receive email announcements from us about our DVD releases and related ASL products.

This is the first ASL DVD for kids and adults to learn the fundamentals of American Sign Language about everyday life with fun and lessons about kindness and compassion.

Go to www.everydayasl.com to sign up to receive email announcements from us about our DVD releases and related ASL products.

title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 2 Preview #1

media$title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 2 Preview #1

media$description.$t:
This preview is from our 2nd DVD, which will be released late 2007 - represents a small part of the DVD.  You will learn and recognize some idioms, classifiers and a diverse number of ASL structures along with components of ASL used in everyday life environments.

This is the second ASL DVD for kids and adults to learn the fundamentals of American Sign Language about everyday life with fun and lessons about kindness and compassion.

Go to www.everydayasl.com to sign up to receive email announcements from us about our DVD releases and related ASL products.

title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 1 Preview #1

media$title.$t: American Sign Language for Kids & Adults, Vol. 1 Preview #1

media$description.$t:
This is the first ASL DVD for kids and adults to learn the fundamentals of American Sign Language about everyday life with fun and lessons about kindness and compassion.

Go to www.everydayasl.com to sign up to receive email announcements from us about our DVD releases and related ASL products.

This first DVD includes:

- Narration with hundreds of fascinating and important facts about animals at the Central Park Zoo in the heart of New York City and learn why they are very special in ASL

- Nearly 3 hours of video on 2 discs!

- Open-captioned & Voice overs

- Amazing animal rescues

- Rare Antarctic animal footages

- Idioms in ASL

- Everyday words in ASL

- Weather vocabulary and activities in ASL

- ASL sentence structure

- ASL music videos

- Extra help in fingerspelling

- Bloopers

- Hundreds of beautiful pictures and videos

...and many more
